definitions.definition: to reach, or cause something to reach, the temperature at which a liquid starts to turn into a gas:
examples: Liquid nitrogen boils at a very low temperature.

definitions.definition: to heat a container, especially one used for cooking, until the liquid in it starts to turn into a gas:
to cook food by putting it in water that is boiling:
examples: I've boiled some potatoes for dinner.

definitions.definition: If a container or food boils dry, all the liquid in the container in which the food was cooking turns to gas.
to wash clothes in a container of very hot water
a painful swelling on the skin that is filled with pus (= thick, yellow liquid)
